name: lady selling sweets
normalized: how unusual of you to stop by.

name: towako
normalized: sweets are good every once in a while.

name: lady selling sweets
normalized: you should come over more often.
anyway, here's a seaweed rice cakeon the house.
the girl pays for the sweets and puts the package into her bag.
she leaves, enjoying the free cake.
the strong taste of bean jam fillsher mouth.

name: towako
normalized: ah…i haven't tasted such a tasty seaweed cake in a while.
it's morita, the electronics store owner and the president of reika'sfanclub.

name: towako
normalized: mister morita, are you skipping work again?

name: morita
normalized: just enjoying a change of scenery, is all.

name: morita
normalized: by the way, how is reika feeling?
she caught some kind of flu a while back.

name: towako
normalized: she is fine now and waits for me at thelibrary.
towako smiles with her usual everyday smile.
she is greeted by reika and rodrigo upon her return to the library.
reika is expected to be here, but rodrigo probably came looking fora book.

name: towako
normalized: if that's how you feel, then here.
the girl sets down a bag of sweets she just bought.

name: towako
normalized: i just bought a few down at the sweets shop.
are they not to your liking, rodrigo?

name: rodrigo
normalized: but it seems unusual foryou to get a sweet tooth out of nowhere.
rodrigo grins like he wants to add something.
towako realizes what itis and looks around the library.
she sees the back of a person in kimono sitting in a chair.
the old man must've heard her come in, but he remains in his seatreading a book.

name: towako
normalized: (he is really reluctant to come here…is he ashamed to face me?

name: towako
normalized: (when you're an elder you shoud pay more attention…but maybe that'stoo much to ask?
ryumei managed to clear up the misunderstanding about her parents andhow they tried to keep her away from the abe family obligations.
but although the tensions between him and towako have lessened, it isstill too early to say that they get along like proper relatives.
but because they are the only remaining members of the abe family,they try to tolerate one another.
the old diviner even asked rodrigo if he knows a good library, usingit as pretext to get closer to his granddaughter.
slowly but steadily, he and towako try to get along.
the young diviner suppresses her urge to complain and hands over thebag to reika.

name: reika
normalized: if i may ask, for how many people?

name: towako
normalized: ugh…surely you can figure it out yourself?
towako replies shyly and looks away.

name: reika
normalized: i'll be back in a moment.
reika bows and leaves to prepare the tea with cakes.

name: rodrigo
normalized: back to your bratty self, i see.
well, when are you going to invitehim to join?
the question catches her off guard.

name: rodrigo
normalized: reika is busy, i'm a guest, so who else should invite himto join?
the guy says with a straight face.
she stiffens up and approaches her grandpa.

name: towako
normalized: (come on, it is not that difficult.

name: towako
normalized: umm…reika is making tea, so…how should i put it…would you liketo join us, grandpa?
she still has a long way to go if she cannot say "plus i bought yourfavourite sweets".

name: ryumei
normalized: i see…hmm, yes, if you went through the trouble of inviting me,i shall accept.
my throat does feel a bit dry.
the old man gives a needlessly convoluted reply and gets out of hischair.
the four of them are siting around the table and enjoying tea withcakes.

name: rodrigo
normalized: inviting your grandfather for tea is a very taxing task.
she glances at the snickering man and sips tea from her cup.
ryumei wanted to say something, but her change in attitude from apolite lady to a brash punk surprised him.

name: ryumei
normalized: ah…towako, how are things at school lately?
towako didn't expect this question and gets flustered.
they have a hard time starting a conversation.

name: rodrigo
normalized: you were gone for a month.
how are you managing to catch up?
rodrigo comes to the rescue with a wry smile.

name: towako
normalized: i'm a honour student, you know.

name: rodrigo
normalized: you really are a wolf in a sheep's clothing, you know that?

name: towako
normalized: that's just another side of me.
towako once again replies in a lady-like manner.

name: reika
normalized: it is as you say, milady.
ryumei looks like he cannot understand his granddaughter at all.
probably sensing the distance between them, he remains silent and sipsfrom the cup.

name: towako
normalized: ah, um…if you like it, i could buymore.

name: reika
normalized: there is a highly important task ihave forgotten.

name: reika
normalized: since i will be gone for a while, could i ask you to look at masterryumei's documents in my absence?

name: reika
normalized: you are far more capable to understand the notes leftbehind by your esteemed parents than i am, milady.

name: reika
normalized: moreover, master ryumei was looking through your father's books forclues on how to defeat the "white-faced, golden-furred nine-tailedfox".

name: reika
normalized: and if two people of the abe blood cannot figure it out, then whocan?!

name: rodrigo
normalized: i shall help you with your very important task, reika.

name: reika
normalized: then we shall take our leave, milady.
the two of them disappear with surprising swiftness.
towako and ryumei are left all alone.
the girl sighs in her mind and smiles at her grandfather.

name: towako
normalized: well then…could you help me out?
the two people had come to terms with their family's destiny as theyextend a helping hand to each other.
their battle against the monstrous fox spirit is only beginning.
but so does their new life as grandfather and granddaughter.
